section.p: This section describes the parameters required to create a group. Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Subscriber Manager> Groups tab.
To add a group, click , add the basic details, associations, and custom data to the group as described in the given table:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the user ID for the group.
When no ID is assigned, the system provides a UUID. Enter a string that represents the ID for the group.
This parameter indicates the name of the group.
This parameter indicates the parent list of the group IDs.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the traversal order of hierarchy.

For example, consider that a hierarchy has two level groups, Management (top group) and Finance (next level group). If the traversal order is selected as Top-Down for Management, then the subscriptions of management group comes first followed by the subscriptions of the finance group.

row.entry: Select either Top-Down or Bottom-Up from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the security domain associated with the group.
Select the pre-configured security domain from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the name of the notification profile associated with the group.
Select the required notification profile associated with the group.
This parameter indicates the name of the lifecycle that you want add to the group.
This parameter indicates the state of the group.

Denotes the time used for entity lifecycle of group and refers to the validity time of a given state of that lifecycle. It is set when timer is configured in a lifecycle state transition. It is a read only parameter and is not set/updated in the Create/Update requests of lifecycle entities. It is only set internally by the lifecycle state transitions.
Set when timer is configured in lifecycle state transition
This parameter provides the list of aggregate view created that can be selected for the group.
Select the required aggregate view from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates a list of administrators for the group being created or updated.

entry.p: A group either has zero or more users as administrators.

row.entry: This parameter indicates a list of devices for the group being created or updated.

entry.p: Add subscriptions: Click the ADD SUBSCRIPTIONS button to add more than one subscription.
The following parameters are listed when you click the ADD SUBSCRIPTIONS button:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of the bundle in the subscription.
Select the required bundle from the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the account name associated with the subscription.

entry.p: Enter a unique account name in this field.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the fee for subscription.

entry.p: Add custom data: This enables to add custom data dictionary to a group.
The following parameters are listed when you click the ADD CUSTOM DATA button:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the name of a custom data pre-configured in the custom data dictionary.
Select the required key from the drop-down list.
Mandatory if custom data is added.
This parameter indicates the type that is not configurable and pre-configured in the custom data dictionary.

entry.p: Select the type from the drop-down list that can be either of the following:

row.entry: Mandatory if custom data is added.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the value for the type configured.
Note: For every value that you add, press the Enter key and click Save.

row.entry: This is a pre-selected drop-down. It indicates a value as per the value of the key parameter selected.
Mandatory if custom data is added.
